intro: Utricularia albocoerulea, commonly known as the blue-veined bladderwort, is a carnivorous plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its small, aquatic or semi-aquatic growth habit and specialized bladder-like structures used to trap prey. The plant typically features delicate, branched stems with small, scale-like leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it produces small, inconspicuous fruits. Utricularia albocoerulea is found in freshwater habitats and is adapted to nutrient-poor environments.
